definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate

sentences.english: Reporter with the provincial disease control departments to local visits.
sentences.chinese: 记者随省疾控部门到当地走访。

sentences.english: I’m shocked when I go to college campuses.
sentences.chinese: 当走访大学校园时我感到震惊。

sentences.english: Workers' Party (WP) reaching out to the constituents of Aljunied GRC.
sentences.chinese: 工人党走访阿裕尼集选区，接见选民。

sentences.english: Today, Dr. LI Xiangning and Wilfrield visited two store houses in Zhenru, Putuo.
sentences.chinese: 今天，李翔宁与石思平等走访真如副中心的两个仓库。

sentences.english: A friendly shopkeeper suggests I explore Lanai 's Shipwreck Beach.
sentences.chinese: 一位友善的店老板建议我走访拉奈岛上的船难海滩。

sentences.english: Quinn went to Albany, the state capital, and began knocking on doors.
sentences.chinese: 奎因到纽约的首府奥尔巴尼，开始到处走访。

sentences.english: The prominent politician from Washington is visiting our town tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 华盛顿来的著名政治家明天要来我们镇走访。

sentences.english: Every new executive must do the rounds of all the departments in the company.
sentences.chinese: 每次新任总管都得到所有的部门走访一遍。

sentences.english: Visiting the villagers is Xu Jun's regular work.
sentences.chinese: 走访村民是徐君的工作内容之一。

sentences.english: They revisit mutual haunts and mutual friends.
sentences.chinese: 他们会重回旧地，或者走访一些双方共同的朋友。

sentences.english: This reporter visited several random practice of " one- room price ."
sentences.chinese: 本报记者随机走访了几个实行“多房一价”的项目。

sentences.english: We beat up the quarters of some of our less-known relatives in New York last time we went there.
sentences.chinese: 上次到纽约时，我们走访了一些家住那里的远房亲戚。

sentences.english: This will require a visit by a census worker.
sentences.chinese: 他们会要求普查局工作人员进行走访。

sentences.english: The next day, I cruised over to my old neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 第二天我便到处去走访那些老街坊。

sentences.english: On the afternoon following the visit of Javert, M. Madeleine went to see Fantine according to his wont.
sentences.chinese: 在沙威走访的那个下午，马德兰先生仍照常去看芳汀。

sentences.english: I think this is too rushed for me to visit my relatives over there.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得这对要去走访在那边的亲戚的我来说太赶了。

definition: to seek by inquiry or search/to call on/to visit
to inspect/to run through a checklist/to take stock/to audit
to make secret inquiries/to investigate in secret
to obtain (information from an archive etc)
open enquiries and secret search (idiom); to investigate openly and in secret/taking information from all sides
investigation/inquiry/to investigate/to survey/survey/(opinion) poll/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to have a clear view (of a situation)/to fish for information/fact-finding
(of a cadre etc) to work for a period of time with a grassroots unit to gain firsthand experience/(dialect) taking a crap
